intro: Hieracium carpathicum, commonly known as the Carpathian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from June to August. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and forest edges.
